page.title: 04Housing (cont) and Leisure
page.content: There was a bad flood in 1953. Some of our houses were flooded then. Where Langer School has its playing field there used to be prefabs put up after World War II but after the flood they were demolished. In local houses there are squeaks in the floor and salt in the plaster from the flood. A little river behind Langer School used to be tidal but since the flood it is closed from the sea by a sluice. It is now fresh water bordered by reeds. The school caretaker has seen kingfishers and children find frogspawn, minnows and sticklebacks. Langer Park has swings, a slide, tunnels and a climbing frame. It gets very muddy in wet weather because the soil here is not sand but clay which does not drain properly. A Guy Carnival has been held here for the last 12 years on 5th Nov, organised by Felixstowe Sports Council.
